channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clean off graffiti Tag on Elcot Avenue wall behind grass area, 6th July
item.description:
Please clean this off. Do not just paint a square over it please. We are trying to maintain this area.

item.title: Housing officer Denise Corbin was seen causing dangerous driving on Semley Gate, garage car park Osborne Road. Housing officer was pulling out of Semley Gate car park t junction onto the main road of Osborne Road housing officer Denise Corbin did not do observation before pulling out to do a right turn nearly colliding with a red Mazda car registration number IXZ 6484 which was on the main road travelling towards Gainsborough school direction. The housing officer Denise corbin forced the driver of the red Mazda registration number IXZ 6484 to do a emergency stop maneuver sounding his horn at hackney council housing manager Denise Corbin to alert her to his presents on 01/07/25 at 10:49am. Housing officer Denise Corbin then reversed her vehicle back into Semley Gate car park of the main road to allow the driver to pass who she nearly collided with. This whole event cause quite a disturbance with surrounding neighbours hearing, seeing the driver sanding his horn in annoyance with the hackney council housing manager Denise Corbin. This was witness by members of public. Housing officer Denise Corbin is a dangerous driver to be on the road. Someone can investigate this incident., 6th July
item.description:
Housing manager, careless driving nearly caused a collision.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Semley Gate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very DIRTY, MESSY and NEGLECTED!!!, 6th July
item.description:

item.title: Rubbish dumped again, 6th July
item.description:
I moved overflowing private bins further down the alley to Halesworth Close. Now the bins aren’t being used at all, but the rubbish continues to be dumped against my garden wall attracting rats in an alley that leads to a school. Give these people bins.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Southwold Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 items have been dumped in these locations, 6th July
item.description:
Outside 169 is a metal frame of some sort like a bed frame, outside 175 is a plastic 3 tier storage unit and outside 195 underneath the lamppost bin is a baby walker, makes the whole road look awful, I don’t know why people do this, it’s very frustrating
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Elmers End Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering on every inch of hassett road, 6th July
item.description:
Broken glass and littering not being cleared. Witnessed street cleaner sweeping under a bin and walking past litter, causing build up over months. Lots of broken glass and littering blowing and being walked into garden. Please clean

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hassett Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: By the bins on Risdon Street SE16, 6th July
item.description:
All this was dumped here on Saturday and it all came from Albion Street Fish and Chip shop. They’re clearing out their garage at the back of the shop and just thought it was ok to dump it there instead of disposing of it themselves. The council had just removed bed bases and mattresses from there that morning and they were dumped there by 2 Risdon House which is privately owned. So there you go Southwark Council, u know where it’s come from and the question is “WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO ABOUT IT”?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Renforth Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Gulley, 6th July
item.description:
There is a blocked gulley on Stansfield Road near to the junction of Stockwell Road. When it rains the road is full of water as a result.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stansfield Road, Stockwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
